snippet: Even as finance ministers from euro zone countries extended the deadline for Greece to make budget cuts, there were signs of continuing disagreement over details of the bailout.
abstract: Finance ministers from euro zone countries extend deadline by two more years for Greece to make budget cuts, but there are signs of continuing disagreement over details of the bailout; put off until Nov 20 any decision to give country long-delayed payment worth $40 billion.
lead_paragraph: Even as finance ministers from euro zone countries extended the deadline for Greece to make budget cuts, there were signs of continuing disagreement over details of the bailout.

headline.seo: Europe Gives Greece Two More Years for Budget Cuts
headline.main: Europe Gives Greece More Time for Budget Cuts
headline.print_headline: Europe Gives Greece More Time for Budget Cuts
